briefTitle: Optimizing Smoking Cessation for People With HIV/AIDS Who Smoke
officialTitle: Optimizing Smoking Cessation for People With HIV/AIDS Who Smoke
summary: The single greatest health behavior change that could improve cardiovascular morbidity and associated mortality is to assist people living with HIV/AIDS who smoke to quit. The investigators will use a factorial design to evaluate the most promising behavioral and pharmacologic treatments aimed at achieving maximal efficacy for smoking cessation among people living with HIV/AIDS who smoke. Results of this study will provide crucial, real world evidence of the best way for healthcare providers to help smokers living with HIV/AIDS quit smoking.

primaryOutcome.measure: Number of Participants With 7-day Point Prevalence Abstinence at 36 Weeks
